data.title: Hugh Joseph Gallen (1924-1982)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Hugh Gallen born 1924 Portland, Multnomah, Oregon, United States died 1982 Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, United States including parents + 1 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
[children unknown]

Profile last modified 27 Sep 2023 | Created 20 Jan 2015

This page has been accessed 717 times.

Preceded by

73rd Governor

Meldrim

Thomson, Jr. Hugh Gallen

74th Governor

of New Hampshire

1979-1982 Succeeded by

Acting Governor

Vesta M. Roy

Biography

Hugh Gallen is Notable.

Hugh Joseph Gallen was an American automobile dealer and Democratic politician from Littleton, New Hampshire. After serving in the New Hampshire House of Representatives, he served as the 74th governor of New Hampshire from 1979 until his death in 1982.

Hugh Joseph Gallen was born on July 30, 1924 in Portland, Multnomah, Oregon, United States, son of Hugh Joseph Gallen (1887–1951) and Mary Kane (1903–>1940).[1]

In 1930, Hugh was living in Medford, Middlesex, Massachusetts. [2] [3]

In 1940, Hugh was living in Medford, Middlesex. [4]

Hugh registered for the draft for World War II. [5], [6]

Hugh (24) married Irene Threasa Carbineau (21) (born on December 25, 1926 in Littleton, Grafton, New Hampshire, United States; daughter of William Eleazer Carbineau and [mother]) on October 16, 1948 in Littleton, Grafton.

Hugh died on December 29, 1982 in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, aged 58.[7] [8] [1] [9] He was buried in Saint Rose of Lima New Catholic Cemetery, Littleton, New Hampshire.
